text.author: Wikinews
text.title: NASA celebrates 30th anniversary of first shuttle launch; announces new homes for retired shuttles
text.summary: On April 13, 2011, NASA celebrated the Space Shuttle program's 30th anniversary and upcoming final mission at the Kennedy Space Center in Cape Canaveral, Florida, and announced that the remaining three shuttles would be relocated to museums in New York, Washington and Los Angeles, prompting critcism from competing sites.
text.summary2: NASA Administrator Charles Bolden announces where Space Shuttles Enterprise, Discovery, Endeavor, and Atlantis will be retired following the end of the Space Shuttle Program, in which some people were disappointed with the final location decisions.
